required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Show That the Combined Hepatitis A and B Vaccine is Non-inferior to Monovalent Vaccines in Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluate the Effect of Risk Factors That Influence the Immunogenicity of GSK Biologicals' Twinrix Compared to Hepatitis A and Hepatitis B Vaccines Given Separately and to Show the Non-inferiority Between the Vaccines in Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This protocol posting describes the booster phase of the study. The objectives & outcome measures of the primary phase are presented in a separate protocol posting (NCT number = NCT00289731).

detailed_description.textblock: All subjects will receive a dose of the vaccine that they received in the primary study (100382), approximately 4 years after the first dose. Blood samples will be taken before and after the administration of the vaccine dose to evaluate the anti-HAV and anti-HBs antibody response.

primary_outcome.measure: Anti-HAV immune response to the challenge dose
Anti-HBs antibody response to the challenge dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with anti-HAV antibody titres ≥ 15 mIU/ml and GMTs calculated on seropositive subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks and one month after the challenge dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with anti-HBs antibody titres ≥ 3.3 mIU/ml, ≥ 10 mIU/ml, ≥ 100 mIU/ml and anti-HBs GMTs calculated on seropositive subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks and one month after the challenge dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and intensity of solicited local symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the 4-day follow-up period after the challenge dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence, intensity and relationship of solicited general symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the 4-day follow-up period after the challenge dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence, intensity and relationship to vaccination of unsolicited symptoms reported
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day follow-up period after the challenge dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of all serious adverse events (SAEs) reported
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Following the administration of the challenge dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who the investigator believes that they can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- A male or female who completed the primary vaccination phase of the study.
- Written informed consent obtained from the subject.
- If the subject is female, she must be of non-childbearing potential, or, if of childbearing potential, she must be abstinent or have used adequate contraceptive precautions for 30 days prior to vaccination, have a negative pregnancy test and must agree to continue such precautions for two months after completion of the vaccination series.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product other than the study vaccines within 30 days preceding the first dose of study vaccine, or planned use during the study period.
- History of any hepatitis A or hepatitis B vaccination or infection, since the primary vaccination study.
- History of allergic disease or reactions likely to be exacerbated by any component of the vaccine.
- Acute disease at the time of enrolment.
- Pregnant or lactating female.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

clinical_study.keyword: combined hepatitis A and B vaccine

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.
